titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 227
CWG12064

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL's OFFICE,
Washington, July 5th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 227.

(Extract.)
11. Thomas McCue, a recruit enlisted for the 2d Kentucky Infantry, is hereby assigned, at his own request, to the 7th U. S. Infantry, the regiment for which he enlisted having been mustered out of service.
The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the necessary transportation.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.x

2 Infy
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington July 5. 1864
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Spe. Ord. 22.7. Thos McCue an enlisted man 2nd Ky Infy is at his own request transferred to the regular army 7" U. S. Infy the Regiment for which he enlisted having been mustered out of service
